headline: Cream Cheese Squares
description: These cream cheese bars are quick and easy to make with crescent roll dough layered with cream cheese and cinnamon sugar for a quick and tasty treat.

video.description: Flaky crescent dough layered with sweet cream cheese filling.
video.name: Cream Cheese Squares

name: Cream Cheese Squares
recipeIngredient: 2 (8 ounce) cans refrigerated crescent roll dough

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
Unroll one can of crescent rolls and press dough into the bottom of the prepared pan. Set second can aside.

Mix together cream cheese, 1 cup sugar, and vanilla in a medium bowl until smooth and creamy. Spread over crescent dough layer. Unroll second can of crescent rolls and lay dough on top of cream cheese mixture; do not press down.
Pour melted margarine over the entire pan. Combine remaining 1/4 cup sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl; sprinkle on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until top is crisp and golden, 25 to 30 minutes. Once cool, cut into 24 squares.

review.reviewBody: I spread a can or cherry or apple pie filling over the cream cheese and bake about 5 min longer. Easy way to make German strudel.
I love the taste 😋
I would use less margarine next time

So after reading reviews I made some changes. I used puff pastry, 1/2 cup of monk fruit sweetener, 1 egg and the same amount of butter. I put some cinnamon on the bottom pastry, put the cream cheese in, put the second pastry on top, poured the butter on top, used a pastry brush to even out the butter, put the cinnamon on top. Put in the oven for 30 min, turned around half way through added some sugar to the top finished off. It came out really good and the crust came out nice and buttery.
So yummy you will go back for more.
Very delicious!!

DELICIOUS! Easy recipe. I cut recipe ingredients in half, only making it for 3 of us. Used prep'd pie crust because that's all I had in the house. Cut dough in half, rolled out thin, one for bottom and half for top. Trimmed excess on bottom but folded over sides of top. Came out pretty! I used a bit less sugar and cinnamon mix for topping, which was fine. SOOOOO good!!
I made this I love it. I actually used one package cream cheese and 1 package Neufchâtel cheese. After I spread the filling I swirled in guava jam and baked following the recipe. This was a hit

I'm from the south, and I have a serious sweet tooth. I loved it just the way it is written. I've made this several times. The only time it didn't come out delicious, is when I didn't use an aluminum pan. If you use a glass dish, the underside won't cook as fast, and the bottom layer of dough will be way under done.

I have made this several times now for my family of 5 with lots of friends and family always visiting. Everyone loves it. Definitely tastes best within a hour or so of making but still great next day. Only thing I change is cooking it on a preheated cookie sheet. Thanks for a great tasting easy recipe.

I have made this recipe many times. Everyone loves it. I am always asked to make it for family dinners and potlucks I have also made it adding different fruit pie fillings.. Any fillings are good are good, My family loves apple, cherry and peach the most.
My first time making this . Won't be my last . For sure .
It was wonderful. I made it for a church gathering and next time I'll make 2 of them. Several people said I didn't get any. Just to say it's a big hit🙂

I took the advice of others who have made this recipe and I took it one step further. Everyone who has tasted the recipe has loved it and they all want me to make them some. I went on Amazon and bought some 8x8x2" aluminum baking pans with lids and I take the basic recipe and simply split it between the 2 cake pans. In addition I took a 21 oz can of cherry pie filling and spread it over the cream cheese filling and once the cream cheese filling was covered with the cherry pie filling I shook some powered confectioners sugar on top of the cherry pie filling to tame the tartness of the cherry pie filling before I covered it with the remaining crescent roll topping and then finished the recipe as written with the melted margarine and sugar/cinnamon before baking it in the oven. I did use my mixer to mice up the cherry pie filling as it has large cherries in it as it comes out of the can. The result was a much more decadent dessert square. My friends and relatives wholeheartedly approved the changes I made. Try it... You can also use a 21 oz can of apple pie filling which is even as good as using the cherry pie filling. Yummy
Delicious and simple! Made a batch and a half😋
If there were 10 stars - I'd give it 10! I like to serve this warm or cold w/ sliced strawberries and even pecans although it doesn't need them, why not!
I make this easy, delicious recipe quite often and they are always a hit! 😋😋😋Thank you for sharing the recipe!
Great warm with a cup of coffee. We added raspberry consume on the cream cheese layer. Delicious 😋
Followed recipe do not change anything they devoured it many compliments they never knew it was croissant dough delicious
Good recipe added lemon pie filling for a nice tang. Could do cherry or any flavor.

I did not make any changes and the recipe came out perfect. If you are looking to alter this recipe I suggest you look for a recipe with the alternatives that you wish to use. Love this recipe just the way it is.
Super easy and delicious.
Easy and tasty. A crowd favorite.
It is so dang good!
Fantastic. I chill the pan before cutting it into squares and I add pecans to the mix.
I have added fruit etc but found this recipe to be delicious. I did thou use less butter for the top! Everyone asks for it!
This was a quick and easy recipe… I used Butter Flake crescent rolls instead and they were very delicious 🤤😋🤤😋🤤… my co-workers loved them so I sent them the recipe
I cooked the bottom slightly before adding a layer of blueberry pie filling and then the cream cheese on top of the filling.
Delicious and easy ☺️
Made as directed...loved it Was thinking next time instead of vanilla...do juice from lemon and some zest to make a lemon crm cheese bar....next time..I love to play while cooking
It’s super easy and so good! Just wondering what’s the best way for storage for there’s?
I added apple pie filling and came out great!
I added 16 oz of ricotta along with a 1/2 cup of sugar.
So easy my people devour them.
I only used 3/4 c sugar and omitted the sugar on top. They were excellent.
These reminded me of a cheese danish.
Made this for the first time today. I used one tube crescent rolls lining my dish with parchment. I spread some blackberry jam over the cream cheese mixture and baked for 27 minutes.

It’s a sugar and fat bomb, so yes we all still ate it, but it was very… blah. The proportions of butter and sugar were definitely excessive. I made as written and the butter literally pooled on top. Although the recipe was incredibly easy, there was nothing interesting about it. It would be a nice base recipe to add fun flavor combinations to, but as-is I would never make it again.

It is creamy and absolutely delicious! I mixed mine up some. I used olive oil verse butter. Sprayed the bottom, and top. Warmed up the cream cheese as well to make it easier to mix. It works well with a circler pan as well! I cooked mine for about 20 to 25 minutes though.
Accidentally used one cream cheese pack instead of two… oops. It still turned out really good however! I will definitely be making it again.

The taste was absolutely delicious! I do not consider myself a cook, so I do not know what happened. The top was beautiful- crisp and light brown, but the bottom wasn't cooked-very doughy. I put it back in the oven and covered the top and the bottom baked well enough, but I wanted it a little more firm. I took it out because I was afraid the top would burn. For those of you in the know, would it be possible to cook the bottom, then add the cream cheese and cook it per the directions? I did take others advice and added some fruit on top of the cream cheese and I do not know if that affected the fact that it didn't cook on the bottom. Excluding the bottom- superb and I will definitely make this again! YUMMY!
very good! I could eat the whole thing! thank you for the recipe!
Very good and simple to make, I will reduce sugar next time due I have diabetes. I think drop it too 3/4 cup sugar.

I only made a couple of little changes to the recipe. I added lemon flavor along with the vanilla, and I used 1/2 cup of Pyure Organic Stevia Sweetener instead of the sugar in the cream cheese. It is twice as sweet as sugar so that amount was just right. Super easy and fast recipe, and very good too. I might try adding blueberries next time.

Had to cook at 375 for 36 min
350 for 20min wasn't enough time to get done
Omg!!! These are to die for!! Easy and insanely good
I made this for my church during resurrection Sunday, I had not a single crumb left behind. Definitely going to make this again and again and again :)

I have made these many time...quick n easy dessert. Plus I add 3/4 cup sugar and pie topping before the second Cresent roll is added. You will have to bake a little longer but it now is a request for many people. When making plain, I stick to the 3/4 cup or less due to personal taste.
Everyone loved this one! I added an egg to the cream cheese mixture along with a couple tablespoons of lemon juice and zest from one lemon- super delicious!
It would have been great but it was WAY TOO SWEET!

Awesome recipe, thank you so much for sharing!!! I've now made this many times, the flexibility of this recipe is amazing. 1) have made it with the cream cheese (CC) as a base, topped with 1/2 pint fresh blueberries, 2) only 1/2c sugar in the CC and one heaping tablespoon sugar in the melted butter, 3) dusted the dough w/ coconut flour (can use almond, hazelnut, etc. flour) for an extra hint of flavor, 4) can skip the cream cheese and use a favorite chocolate bar... the possibilities are endless. It truly tastes like a pastry! I cut it into squares and save in refrig or freezer. I toast in a pan to heat again before serving. THANK YOU, it's a great way to have, on-hand, a treat the seems so much more complicated than it is - has a croissant-like pastry taste w/o all the work!!
A little too sweet. Next time I'll use less sugar. I added chopped nuts. Add cinnamon to cream cheese layer next time.

These were easy and delicious. I made to take for dessert as guests at friends for dinner. Walked out of the kitchen for 10 minutes and came back to only a quarter of the pan left. So note to self hide in the future or it will not make the trip
The people who give a low rating must be horrible bakers. This was stupidly easy to make, and greatly enjoyed by the whole family! Also, the perfect amount of cream cheese. Yummy!
Sprinkled powdered sugar and fresh blueberries with on top of cream cheese mixture. Delicious

Great simple recipe for a tasty treat! I made some minor adjustments after reading reviews. I prebaked the bottom layer for ten minutes to avoid a soggy bottom. I used the full amount of cream cheese and sugar in the filling but added two eggs and 1/2 tsp lemon extract for additional flavor and to lighten up the middle. I used a full half cup of butter on top with the amount of sugar and cinnamon stated and it came out beautifully! The butter and sugar caramelized to a nice crust, I would not recommend cutting it back. I also used sweet Hawaiian crescent rolls instead of plain. Super tasty & look nice. Will definitely make these again!
Quick easy to make. My family loves it
Absolutely love it!

Easy and tasty!! Instead of only butter on the top, cut the butter in half and add 1 egg white, then brush that mixture over the top before baking. It'll give the top a slight crisp and shiny presentation!
Omg we can’t stop eating these!!!! Just melts in your mouth! The top is like a sweet buttery crepe brûlée top!

really simple saves a lot of time and tastes close to the real thing. before putting the top crescent on top layered my home made fresh crushed bananas one side and home made cran=blueberry orange marmilade whole berry sauce half side. Stick to the recipe it comes out nice and crispy.
I accidentally picked up Honey Butter flavored crescent roll dough and decided it sounded like a decent substitution. It worked too well...I have probably put on 5 lbs since I made these.
I will make this recipe again but will cut down on the sugar. As written, the recipe is too sweet for me. I will reduce the amount of sugar next time and play around with it.

Great recipe! Extremely easy to make and very tasty. Great for last minute dinner guests. I have also made it with pastry dough and topped it with a fruit compote, adds a flakier texture and more of a pastry feel. Really good!
I make this all the time. It is absolutely delicious. I wouldn’t change a thing.

These are very easy,quick to make, and one slab makes a great breakfast.Even tho the recipe calls for one cup of sugar, they're not too sweet. I've cut the sugar in half and haven't noticed much of a difference. 
I consider this to be one of my favorite recipes and make it several times a month.

This is an easy and delightful bar cookie. Everyone loved it. I made half with the cinnamon sugar and half with chocolate chips sprinkled over filling. I did add an egg as someone had suggested to make it creamier.

I like to bake and most things come out pretty good. My husband said this was the best ever thatI made. I used a half a cup of butter for the top and it was enough. It was so easy and came out great. It is even better when it is cold the next day. I couldn’t wait and ate it warm and was still good. It is definitely a keeper.
Very quick and uncomplicated recipe. I only made a half size 9x9 pyrex. I used a raspberry preserve filling with the cream cheese. A cap of lemon juice was a nice tart finish. Delicious...
Great
Aaaaaaaaaaamazing! Easy and delicious. This is the first time we made this and it won’t be the last. The next time we have a get together, this is what I am making. Delicious.

These reviews are spot on! Best recipe EVER!! I used half sugar and half Splenda since I’m diabetic and it came out great. To die for. Like the other reviewers, I plan on experimenting with this a bit more! Thanks for posting this!!!!
Very good and easy to make !
I used puff pastry instead of crescent dough and it was delicious!!
BEWARE: It’s hard to eat just one. This is my new favorite sweet treat! Delish!
Yummy!!
very simple to make.. added mango preserves in the layer and believe the recipe calls for 3 crescent rolls. also lessened the sugar and used brown sugar. delicious snack recipe!

Easy to make -- and quick ingredients to throw together.

I substituted almond flavoring and then added chopped almonds on top with the butter/sugar/cinnamon... gave it a different look...
I’ve made this many times and it’s always delicious! Easy to make. If u love cheesecake, u will love this!
Loved it added strawberry pie filling to the top of the cheese layer
2-9-2020 I added cherry filling on top of cream cheese, bit hit!!

I made this again this afternoon and did the following : added 1 egg to cream cheese mixture, a heaping half a cup of sugar, 1 tbsp. lemon zest along with the teaspoon of vanilla, mixed well, and poured over the first layer of rolls. Second layer of rolls was topped with 1 tablespoon of melted butter sprinkled with 1/4 cup of sugar and 1/2 tsp cinnamon. I made mine in a 12" x 8" glass pan for 30 minutes. I let it cool for about 30 minutes and cut a small slice out and it is heavenly, not too sweet and adding the egg makes this dessert filling taste just like cheesecake!!

I took it to a party and 2/3rds were eaten, and I received compliments. But I didn't personally really like it. I guess I didn't like the texture. The dough was crispy out of the oven, but soft/soggy once it all cooled. I think I prefer more crunchy things. 
I recommend 1/2 the internal sugar and 1/2 the butter on top.

I used reduced fat crescent rolls and low fat cream cheese. I used only 1/2 cup sugar in the cream cheese. Perfect. I warmed about 3/4 cup strawberry jam plus a splash of lemon juice in the microwave and spread it over the cream cheese. I melted 4 tbsp of butter to brush on the top but it was too much. 3 tbsp as suggested by others is enough. I sprinkled a little cinnamon and sugar on top and a little raw sugar. This was delicious and perfect. Also used a glass 9 x 13 pan. It baked for 27 min in my oven.
Crescent Roll Crust did not get done, it was too doughy.

These turned out really good. I followed the recipe exactly. The only real problem I ran into were the cresecent rolls. Unfortunately mine were room temperature so they tore easy. The bottom wasn't too bad because I could shape with my hands. I managed to get the top covered but it wasn't "pretty". I reccomend you keep your rolls cold and roll them out into a sheet before laying the sheet ontop. I think the recipe calls for too much butter and sugar. Next time I'll use 4-6 tbsp of butter and a heaping 1/8 cup of sugar. I also think the top would be better using all brown sugar or a mix of brown and white, I'll try that next time.
Tasted really good but filling was a bit sweet. Maybe I could have baked longer, crescent was a bit softer than I thought it would be.Kids enjoyed very much.
My family LOVED this recipe! It was so delicious, I'll make it many more times. Many thanks!
Absolutely delicious! I didn't change a thing and they are one of my favorites
I add 1 eggs beaten to the cream cheese mixture. I’ve also never met anyone who didn’t LOVE these.
Wonderful Christmas treat
Delish! It couldn't be simpler to make!!

Super easy to make, and quite delicious, however- I did find them a little bland. Will definitely make again, but thinking a little cherry pie filling, or lemon curd, would really make these dance! Definitely better warm!
Great recipe!! Everyone loved it!! I will definitely be making this again.
DELICIOUS! I added pecans

Turned out really well. I did add some apricot preserves after the cheesecake layer and brushed on melted butter than pouring. I used less than 1/4 cup and found that was more than enough. Will definitely make again...perhaps for a different Thanksgiving dessert.
I did not make any changes & and this is so easy and delicious! My teen age nephew puts his request in for this every 2 weeks!
Love these squares. Super easy and tasty!
So awesome, I used a smaller pan so they came out thicker. I really want to add some cherry pie filling next time and reduce the amount of sugar added. Easy recipe!
